understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named 'streamEntireSSTables' which returns a boolean value based on a configuration parameter 'conf.stream_entire_sstables'.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration parameter 'stream_entire_sstables' which controls whether Cassandra can zero-copy stream entire eligible SSTables between nodes.

config_description: When enabled, permits Cassandra to zero-copy stream entire eligible SSTables between nodes, including every component. This speeds up the network transfer significantly subject to throttling specified by stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec. Enabling this will reduce the GC pressure on sending and receiving node. When unset, the default is enabled. While this feature tries to keep the disks balanced, it cannot guarantee it. This feature will be automatically disabled if internode encryption is enabled.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'stream_entire_sstables' is used in the code to determine whether Cassandra should stream entire SSTables between nodes. It checks if full SSTable transfers are enabled and if there are any legacy counter shards present before deciding whether to stream the entire SSTables.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration 'stream_entire_sstables' is triggered whenever the method 'computeShouldStreamEntireSSTables()' is called in the code. The frequency of this triggering depends on the specific use case and workload of the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling the 'stream_entire_sstables' configuration allows Cassandra to zero-copy stream entire eligible SSTables between nodes, which can significantly speed up network transfer and reduce GC pressure on sending and receiving nodes. However, it may not guarantee disk balance and will be automatically disabled if internode encryption is enabled.
